class sarkas.processes.PreProcess(input_file=None)[source]¶

Bases: sarkas.processes.Process

Wrapper class handling the estimation of time and best parameters of a simulation.

Parameters

input_file (str) – Path to the YAML input file.

loops¶

Number of timesteps to run for time and size estimates. Default = 10

Type

int

estimate¶

Run an estimate for the best PPPM parameters in the simulation. Default=False.

Type

bool

pm_meshes¶

Array of mesh sizes used in the PPPM parameters estimation.

Type

numpy.ndarray

pp_cells¶

Array of simulations box cells used in the PPPM parameters estimation.

Type

numpy.ndarray

kappa¶

Screening parameter. Calculated from sarkas.potentials.base.Potential.matrix().

Type

float

analytical_approx_pp()[source]¶

Calculate PP force error.

analytical_approx_pppm()[source]¶

Calculate the total force error as given in Dharuman et al. J Chem Phys 146 024112 (2017).

estimate_best_parameters()[source]¶

Estimate the best number of mesh points and cutoff radius.

green_function_timer()[source]¶

Time Potential setup.

make_color_map(rcuts, alphas, chosen_alpha, chosen_rcut, total_force_error)[source]¶

Plot a color map of the total force error approximation.

Parameters

  • rcuts (numpy.ndarray) – Cut off distances.

  • alphas (numpy.ndarray) – Ewald parameters.

  • chosen_alpha (float) – Chosen Ewald parameter.

  • chosen_rcut (float) – Chosen cut off radius.

  • total_force_error (numpy.ndarray) – Force error matrix.

static make_fit_plot(pp_xdata, pm_xdata, pp_times, pm_times, pp_opt, pm_opt, pp_xlabels, pm_xlabels, fig_path)[source]¶

Make a dual plot of the fitted functions.

make_force_error_map_plot()[source]¶
make_lagrangian_plot()[source]¶
make_line_plot(rcuts, alphas, chosen_alpha, chosen_rcut, total_force_error)[source]¶

Plot selected values of the total force error approximation.

Parameters

  • rcuts (numpy.ndarray) – Cut off distances.

  • alphas (numpy.ndarray) – Ewald parameters.

  • chosen_alpha (float) – Chosen Ewald parameter.

  • chosen_rcut (float) – Chosen cut off radius.

  • total_force_error (numpy.ndarray) – Force error matrix.

pppm_approximation()[source]¶

Calculate the Force error for a PPPM simulation using analytical approximations. Plot the force error in the parameter space.

run(loops=None, timing=True, pppm_plots=False, postprocessing=False, estimate=None)[source]¶

Estimate the time of the simulation and best parameters if wanted.

Parameters

  • pppm_plots (bool) – Flag for showing the force error plots in case of pppm algorithm.

  • postprocessing (bool) – Flag for calculating Post processing parameters.

  • timing (bool) – Flag for estimating simulation times. Default =True.

  • loops (int) – Number of loops over which to average the acceleration calculation. Note that the number of timestep over which to averages is three times this value. Example: loops = 5, acceleration is averaged over 5 loops, while full time step over 15 loops.

  • estimate (bool) – Flag for estimating best PPPM parameters.

time_acceleration()[source]¶
time_integrator_loop()[source]¶

Run several loops of the equilibration and production phase to estimate the total time of the simulation.

class sarkas.processes.Process(input_file=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Stage of a Molecular Dynamics simulation. This is the Parent class for PreProcess, Simulation, and PostProcess.

Parameters

input_file (str) – Path to the YAML input file.

Class handling the interaction between particles.

Type

sarkas.potential.base.Potential

integrator¶

Class handling the integrator.

Type

sarkas.time_evolution.integrators.Integrator

Class handling the equilibration thermostat.

sarkas.time_evolution.thermostats.Thermostat

Type

class sarkas.processes.Simulation(input_file=None)[source]¶

Bases: sarkas.processes.Process

Sarkas simulation wrapper. This class manages the entire simulation and its small moving parts.

Parameters

input_file (str) – Path to the YAML input file.

equilibrate()[source]¶

Run the time integrator with the thermostat to evolve the system to its thermodynamics equilibrium state.

Return type

None

evolve()[source]¶

Run the time integrator to evolve the system for the duration of the production phase.

Return type

None

initialization()[source]¶

Initialize all the sub classes of the simulation and save simulation details to log file.

Return type

None

run()[source]¶

Run the simulation.

Return type

None

setup(read_yaml=False, other_inputs=None)[source]¶

Setup simulations’ parameters and io subclasses.

Parameters

  • read_yaml (bool) – Flag for reading YAML input file. Default = False.

  • other_inputs (dict (optional)) – Dictionary with additional simulations options.

sarkas.processes.analytical_approx_pppm_single(kappa, rc, p, h, alpha)[source]¶

Calculate the total force error for a given value of rc and alpha. See similar function above.

sarkas.processes.betamp(m, p, alpha, kappa)[source]¶

Calculate \(eta(m)\) of eq.(37) in Dharuman et al. J Chem Phys 146 024112 (2017)

sarkas.processes.linear(x, a)[source]¶

Linear function for fitting.

Parameters

  • x (np.ndarray) – Values at which to calculate the function.

  • a (float) – Coefficient of linear term.

Returns

_ – linear formula

Return type

np.ndarray

sarkas.processes.quadratic(x, a, b, c)[source]¶

Quadratic function for fitting.

Parameters

  • x (array) – Values at which to calculate the function.

  • a (float) – Intercept.

  • b (float) – Coefficient of linear term.

  • c (float) – Coefficient of quadratic term.

Returns

Return type

quadratic formula
